posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked: How do I setup an ethernet switch on my robot so that I can use two limelights?

I can’t speak on two limelights but setting up a switch is pretty easy. Based on another thread we went with the brainbox.

SW-005 | Brainboxes

Installation was simple. We wired the V+ and V- to our PDP. And simply ran ethernet cable.

Here is the thread I was referring to. Why you probably shouldn’t use the second port on your OpenMesh OM5P Radio and embrace using an Ethernet Switch instead - Technical - Chief Delphi

link_counts.title: Why you probably shouldn't use the second port on your OpenMesh OM5P Radio and embrace using an Ethernet Switch instead

posts.name: Molly Connolly
posts.cooked: How to connect radio, a switch and a limelight General Forum

link_counts.title: How to connect radio, a switch and a limelight

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked:
As @LPryor alluded to, network switches (at least in this context) require virtually zero setup.  Find a way to attach it to your robot, give it power, plug your devices into it via ethernet cables, and it works!

The BrainBox SW-005 is a commonly recommended model as it natively accepts DC power via screw terminals and has a fairly wide range of acceptable input voltages (6-30V i think…?), which should help keep it running in the austere environment of an FRC robot.

That said, many teams use alternatives such as the tp-link model available in FIRSTChoice .

posts.name: Domtech
posts.cooked:
Highly recommend the Brainboxes switch.

One of these is also useful for injecting power to 2 Limelights: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08BLFGWV2/
